The structure of production cost
◦ 4 concepts of cost.
•  Average total cost
•  Average fixed cost
•  Average variable cost
•  Marginal cost
The structure of production cost
◦ Average fixed cost(AFC) is the fixed cost is divided by quantity 
of output. 
   AFC =  fixed cost / output

The structure of production cost
◦ Marginal cost(MC) is the additional cost of producing one more 
unit of output.
  MC = change in total cost / change in output
For example, as quantity produced increases from 10 to 18 chickens, total costs 
rise by 50 (Thus, the marginal cost for one chicken will be 50/8).

The structure of production cost
: the relationship between ATC and MC
◦ Suppose that a 100-meter runner counting his record.
◦ And suppose that the average of 10 records was 10 seconds, 
and the 11th record is 9 seconds.
◦ How will his average record include the new record change? It 
will go down a little.
◦ But, If the 11th record was larger than the former average, 
such as 11 seconds, average record with the additional record 
would rise.
The structure of production cost
: the relationship between ATC and MC
◦ The ATV has the similar concept with the average record, and 
MC is a concept similar to the 11th new record.
◦ Average total cost is somewhat cumulative cost, while marginal 
cost is  the additional cost.
◦ Average total cost become larger and smaller if the marginal 
cost is larger and smaller than the average total cost.

aiNotes.summary: The text outlines the structure of production costs, defining four key concepts: Average Fixed Cost (AFC), Average Variable Cost (AVC), Average Total Cost (ATC), and Marginal Cost (MC). AFC is fixed cost divided by output, AVC is variable cost divided by output, and ATC is total cost divided by output. Marginal Cost is the additional cost incurred from producing one more unit of output. The text also explains the relationship between Marginal Cost and Average Total Cost, illustrating that ATC falls when MC is below it and rises when MC is above it, analogous to how an individual record affects an average.
